title: if i had a hammer...
content:
I'D SMASH THIS COMPUTER INTO THOUSANDS OF PEICES!

Thats right. Once again my computer is being a B**CH. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

All i did was type:
shutdown -s -t 01
in the cmd and it died. It took over an hour to turn it back on.

Why oh why do i put up with this.

title: Re: if i had a hammer...
content:
Okay..

Anyway turns out somthing happened to my harddrive at that instance because the computer wouldnt boot. And apparently windows wasnt installed...

So i had to format. Dont you just hate computers?

title: Re: if i had a hammer...
content:
Machines aren't faulty, the people who made them unknowingly put in those mistakes. And these hardware compatibility thingees...

I wouldn't use a quick shutdown option anyway, as it would probably forget to CORRECTLY close down a few things, maybe including filesystem stuff. Best to use normal shutdown.___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: Re: if i had a hammer...
content: Guess what guys, HD is 'Dead' apparently. Just got it back from the tech. Luckily it was a back-up HD and not the master. Unfortunately now i lost my backup data... so now im stuffed but oh well.

title: Re: if i had a hammer...
content: What's wrong with losing your backup data?  Just make another backup of the original data and you're back in business...

title: Re: if i had a hammer...
content:
yeah well you see, i transfered my data from my master to my slave (perhaps backup is not the right word here).

I thought the data would be safer under the slave which is why i called it 'backup'

title: Re: if i had a hammer...
content: Heh, the irony of calling it a "backup" when it wasn't actually backed up anywhere, and that of all the data you could lose...
